content: Who wrote the classic novel "Pride and Prejudice", published in 1813, that explores issues of manners, upbringing, morality, education, and marriage in the society of the landed gentry of early 19th-century England?

"Pride and Prejudice" was written by Jane Austen, an English novelist known for her wit, social commentary, and insights into the lives of the landed gentry in early 19th-century England. The novel, first published in 1813, is one of her most famous works and has been adapted numerous times into films, TV series, and stage productions. It explores themes such as manners, upbringing, morality, education, and marriage through the lives of the Bennett family and their five daughters.
